featured.text: Mr. Power then spoke with his own primary care doctor, who advised him to find a new specialist to oversee Mrs. Power’s care.
Understanding how pain works in the mind and brain could eventually give doctors tools for helping people cope with painful medical treatments.
Jack and a few of his friends set up a company called “Jack’s Disk Doctor Service” in 1984.
The rule of thumb, however, is to see a doctor first and get an accurate diagnosis.

other.text: The doctor insisted on office visits every three weeks, even when she was feeling well.
Scientific doctors try to observe sicknesses, look for logical patterns, and then find out how the human body works.
The architect always followed the doctor's advice (D)
From the statement “But … most people don’t take any notice of the doctor's advice!”
The problem is made worse by doctors who give their patients large doses of useless drugs.
Her doctor asked her to consult other specialists due to her constant complaints.
“But,” says Jack, “most people don’t take any notice of the doctor’s advice!” 44.
Jonathan had qualified as a doctor but later gave up the of medicine for full-time writing.
According to the passage, what may be the author’s advice to a doctor before a surgery? (A) To provide the patient with more pain killers.
Which of the following statements is NOT true? (A) Jack’s Disk Doctor Service has only one standard fee.
The success of folk medicine led to the development of doctor medicine.
Doctors have repeatedly warned people of the serious effect of noise on their hearing.
One is called “doctor medicine,” or “scientific medicine.”
Disks are usually sent to the Disk Doctor by post, but sometimes people are in such a hurry that they cannot wait for the mail to come.
Folk medicine flourished long before the development of scientific medicine and was more successful in ancient times than doctor medicine.
Under the new doctor’s care, the regular testing stopped and Mrs. Power’s condition stabilized.
She had as many as 25 doctor visits during one six-month period.
Now she sees the doctor only four or five times a year.
It would be difficult to put a value on the things rescued by the Disk Doctor.

definition.zh_def: 醫生，專業從事診斷和治療疾病的人。
definition.en_def: A person who is qualified to treat people who are ill or injured.
definition.example: The doctor examined the patient and prescribed some medication.
